messages.content: Hello, I have some questions about the upcoming medical examinations.
Sure, I'll be happy to help. What would you like to know?
Who is eligible for the medical checkup?

The medical checkup is mandatory for all employees who are employed and covered by social insurance as of the date of the medical checkup. Part-time workers are also eligible if they are enrolled in social insurance.
What are the different types of medical checkups available?

There are three different types of medical checkups available: 
1. Basic medical checkup, which is for employees aged 34 and above.
2. Health insurance designated checkup, which is for employees aged 35 and above.
3. Women's medical checkup, which is available for female employees aged 30 and above and includes additional tests for cervical cancer, ultrasound, and mammogram.
When can I schedule my medical checkup?

The consultation period for the medical checkups is from August 2023. You can check the available appointment dates and schedule your checkup using this link: https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1N6oIpd7wPHcB73yfn7ndcJDjbIQFEniXepKMQtiQO0Y/edit#gid=588601465. Please select 'Confirmed' in the confirmation box after setting your schedule. If you are based outside of Tokyo, we will contact you individually to arrange your checkup.
Where will the medical checkups take place for Tokyo-based employees?

The medical checkups for Tokyo-based employees of MLHD, MLM, and MLO will take place at Ebisu Sakura Juji Clinic. The address is VORT Ebisu maxim B1F, 3-9-19 Higashi, Shibuya-ku, Tokyo 150-0011, Japan. You can find more information about the clinic on their website: https://www.sj-ebisu-clinic.jp/. If you have any questions regarding schedule changes or additional options, please contact the clinic directly.
What should I do if I have not received the test kit within 2 weeks?

If you have not received the test kit within 2 weeks, please contact the person in charge of labor affairs. The test kit will be sent to you approximately 2 to 3 weeks prior to the test. It is important to check the contents of the kit as there may be preparations and dietary restrictions that need to be followed before the test.
How should I apply for reimbursement of transportation expenses?

If you only receive the medical checkup and do not come to work, you can apply for reimbursement of transportation expenses. If you are going to receive the medical checkup in addition to coming to work, you can apply for reimbursement of your regular commuting expenses. Please contact the person in charge, INAKA (MLJP) or SEKIHARA (MLHD, MLM, MLO), for more information.
Is the time of the medical checkup considered working time?
Yes, the time of the medical checkup is considered working time. Please remember to stamp the time accordingly.
Thank you for your help!
You're welcome! If you have any more questions, feel free to ask.
